body_html: Yes, I've been developing pytorch for a long time without Anaconda (and still do on my laptop). Just run python setup.py build_deps && python setup.py develop (build_deps can be run once, develop every time you change C wrapper code, python changes are seen automatically when you restart the interpreter) to install it in develop mode in whatever python you have (as long as it's 2.7 or 3.3+ ofc). python setup.py install to build and install from source.
body_text: Yes, I've been developing pytorch for a long time without Anaconda (and still do on my laptop). Just run python setup.py build_deps && python setup.py develop (build_deps can be run once, develop every time you change C wrapper code, python changes are seen automatically when you restart the interpreter) to install it in develop mode in whatever python you have (as long as it's 2.7 or 3.3+ ofc). python setup.py install to build and install from source.
body: Yes, I've been developing pytorch for a long time without Anaconda (and still do on my laptop). Just run `python setup.py build_deps && python setup.py develop` (`build_deps` can be run once, `develop` every time you change C wrapper code, python changes are seen automatically when you restart the interpreter) to install it in develop mode in whatever python you have (as long as it's 2.7 or 3.3+ ofc). `python setup.py install` to build and install from source.
